entry.title: Maximize the Value of Your HR Data: Introducing People Intelligence in SAP Business Data Cloud APAC
entry.content:
As an existing SAP SuccessFactors customer, you're already collecting valuable HR data. But are you maximizing its value and taking action on it? Join us as we explore how our new People Intelligence application in SAP Business Data Cloud can help you unlock the full potential of your people analytics. In this webinar, we'll demonstrate how this new solution seamlessly integrates data from SAP SuccessFactors HCM and beyond, transforming your people, skills, and business data into actionable, AI-driven workforce insights.
 
Register here
 
Discover how you can:
✔ Break down data silos to turn insights into impact
✔ Gain deeper understanding of your workforce and uncover trends
✔ Make data-driven decisions and take action to support your people and business strategies
 
Our product experts will guide you through the capabilities of People Intelligence and answer your questions along the way. By the end of the session, you'll understand how this new approach can help you build a future-ready foundation for better people and business outcomes. We're excited to show you how People Intelligence can help you maximize the value of your HR data and take meaningful action!
 
EVENT RECORDING DISCLAIMER: This event will be recorded and shared to be watched on-demand. Attending this event indicates your consent to be recorded.

entry.title: Re: Authorisation roles conflicting
entry.content:
While I am not a Security expert, let me try to explain as under

SAP uses additive authorization logic:

  • If a user has multiple roles, SAP checks all authorizations across those roles.
  • If any role grants access to a field group or activity, the user gets that access — even if another role restricts it.

So in your case, Z_SAP_FIN_ROLE_2 allows full access to all field groups. That full access overrides the restrictions in Z_SAP_FIN_ROLE_1 for account groups Z001–Z009.

The recommended solution is assigning authorization groups to Business Partners based on account group (e.g., Z001–Z009 = GRP1, Z004 = GRP2). In each role, restrict access using B_BUPA_GRP so that:

  • Z_SAP_FIN_ROLE_1 only allows GRP1
  • Z_SAP_FIN_ROLE_2 only allows GRP2

This adds a layer of control that’s independent of account group and can be used to segment access more precisely.

Finally, use BAdI BUP_AUTH_CHECK only if:

  • You need to evaluate multiple conditions dynamically (e.g., delivery priority, BP role, user ID)
  • You want to override standard SAP logic based on custom business rules

entry.title: Re: SAP BTP Neo Environment: Problem calling iflow from S...
entry.content:
Hi @Willem_Pardaens, Your comments helped me find a solution.

I had to add this condition to my code and it worked.

_callIflowDestination: async function () {
			// Detect environment: development vs. production
			//
			var isDevelopment = window.location.hostname === "localhost" || window.location.hostname.startsWith("webide");
			var iflowUrl = isDevelopment ? "/destinations/sftp_iflow/" : "/sap/fiori/camsendschedules/destinations/sftp_iflow/";
			console.log("iflowUrl:", iflowUrl);
			console.log("origin:", window.location.origin);
			//fetch("/destinations/sftp_iflow", {
			fetch(iflowUrl, {
				method: "POST",
				headers: {
					"Content-Type": "text/csv",
					"Content-Disposition": `attachment; filename="${this._lastFileName}"`,
				},
				body: this._lastProcessedCSV,
			}).then(response => {
				if (response.ok) {
					MessageToast.show("Archivo procesado y enviado exitosamente.");
				} else {
					response.text().then(text => {
						MessageToast.show("Error: " + response.status + " - " + text);
					});
				}
			}).catch(error => {
				MessageToast.show("Error en la solicitud: " + error.message);
			});
		},

But I would have liked to solve it using neo-app.json or manifest.json.

Thank you so much for your help.

entry.title: Re: Copying a functional area in GR55 Report
entry.content:
The description like “7030 Selling expense” comes from master data maintained in transaction FMD1 or via customizing in FM area settings. If 7031 is newly created or not properly maintained, its description won’t show in the report. Check in FMD1 or your functional area master data to ensure 7031 has a description assigned.

Even if you copy the report in GRR2, the selection criteria, row/column definitions, or set assignments may still be referencing 7030 or its specific characteristics. So in GRR2, open your copied report, Go to General Data Selection, Check if the functional area is hardcoded or part of a set. If it’s using a set (e.g., a value set or variable), you may need to update or recreate that set to include 7031

Areas to check

  • Go to FMD1 or relevant customizing and ensure 7031 is defined and has a description
  • Open the copied report. Go to General Data Selection. Confirm that 7031 is included either directly or via a set
  • Use GS01/GS02 to edit sets. Use GS12 to adjust variables if used in the report
  • After updating, go to GR55 and run the report group and confirm that 7031 appears with the correct description

entry.title: SAP SFX Administration Masterclass Employee Central *MEE/ EMEA customers only*
entry.content:
Our virtual Administration Masterclass Series is designed for SAP SuccessFactors system   administrators, project team members and process owners at customers' side to refresh   and deepen their knowledge in SAP SuccessFactors supported HXM processes and related   software modules. The courses are based on the SFX Accreditation Program, which is a set of exams to accredit trained and empowered customer admins in SAP SuccessFactors products.

Register here

What you can expect in this course:

  • Prepare for the SFX accreditation exam, which can be completed at the end of the courses
  • Get insights into selected processes and features of the relevant SAP SuccessFactors solutions based on the respective Admin Guides
  • Build a network with peer SAP SuccessFactors clients

This offering is complimentary and for MEE/ EMEA SAP SuccessFactors customers with an assigned Customer Success Partner only. Courses take place in English language and in the CET Timezone.

Due to capacity restrictions, seats are limited to 50 participants per course on a first-come first-served basis. As such, we can allow for max two participants per customer company for each course. We use MS Teams as a platform to conduct the sessions. Please note: We cannot accept registrations from private email accounts. Also, the courses are not open for external consultants, only for customer experts.

entry.title: Re: Power BI using SAP BW Application Server
entry.content:
Hi Cristina,

We are using BWOH 7.5 SP25, and we also use PBI as our Visualization standard. We do not present these types of performance issues.

I do have a couple of questions for you:

Are you using Data Import or Direct Query?

If you are using Data Import, have you implemented Query folding?

Are you accessing the data through OLAP or using HANA views?

What are the volumes of data that you are loading to get these times?

Perhaps I can assist you if I gain a better understanding of the scenario.

Regards,

Orlando

entry.title: Re: SAP Document extraction service not working for uploads
entry.content:
Hi! @Samruddhi @vijaygn1990 @SukirtiMaskey 

I just removed the global Content-Type = "multipart/form-data" in the header section and now it works!. In my case, for some reason when importing this collection from SAP Business Accelerator Hub (API link), the header <Content-Type> is repeted, be sure to keep only the value "multipart/form-data; boundary=<calculated when request is sent>"

Posting the fix here in case it helps others

entry.title: End-to-End Business Transformation with SAP AI Tools: A Practical Example
entry.content:
Introduction: Simplifying Grocery Business with AI 🥦🛒

Grocery businesses handling food items and eatables want to deliver products faster, reduce mistakes, and delight customers. SAP offers a suite of AI tools that can automate, predict, and optimize business processes. In this example, we’ll show how a large grocery chain can transform its Order-to-Cash (O2C) process—from receiving orders to delivering products and receiving payments—using SAP AI tools.

Note: O2C is the flow where a customer places an order, the company delivers the product, and receives payment.

1. Organizing Data with SAP Datasphere 🏢💾📊

Objective: Combine data from sales, inventory, shipments, and suppliers into one view.

How it works:

  • Connect SAP systems and external sources (like supply chain partners and e-commerce platforms) 🔗.

  • Transform raw data into business-friendly models for orders, deliveries, and payments 🗂️.

Benefit for growth:
A grocery chain can reduce stock-outs and overstock 📉, understand customer buying patterns 🛍️, and ensure timely deliveries 🚚. With a single source of truth, managers make faster and more informed decisions 🧠.

Analogy: Central nervous system – integrates and harmonizes all data from multiple sources.

2. Managing AI Services with SAP AI Foundation ⚙️🛠️📈

Objective: Provide infrastructure and services to deploy, monitor, and orchestrate AI models efficiently.

How it works:

  • SAP AI Foundation handles model orchestration, monitoring, logging, and deployment pipelines 🖥️.

  • Works seamlessly with AI Core, ML DI tenants, and other AI services 🔄.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can scale AI solutions reliably ⚡, ensuring smooth operations across multiple stores and warehouses 🏬 without disruptions. Managers can monitor model performance in real-time 🕵️, improving efficiency and reducing costs 💰.

Analogy: AI control center – orchestrates and monitors AI models and workflows.

3. Predicting Outcomes with SAP AI Core & ML DI Tenants 🤖📡🔮

Objective: Predict delivery delays, demand spikes, or payment issues.

How it works:

  • Build predictive models in SAP AI Core 🧩.

  • Use ML DI tenants to access pre-trained AI models or train new ones using integrated data from SAP Datasphere 🗄️.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can anticipate high-demand periods 📈, avoid perishable food wastage 🥬❌, and ensure timely replenishment 🚛. Predictive insights also help in identifying potential payment delays 💳 or customer churn 🔄, boosting revenue and trust.

Analogy: Predictive brain – builds and deploys AI models for forecasting and insights.

4. Automating Tasks with SAP Build Process Automation 🔄🤖📝

Objective: Reduce manual work and speed up processes.

How it works:

  • Automate routine O2C tasks like approving orders ✅, sending invoices 🧾, and following up on payments 📬.

  • Integrate AI predictions to trigger actions automatically ⚡.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can process orders faster ⏱️, minimize human errors ❌, and focus staff on higher-value tasks 💼. Automation ensures smoother operations and higher customer satisfaction 😃.

Analogy: Workflow robot – automates repetitive tasks and business processes.

5. Guiding Employees with SAP Joule 💡📌🧑‍💼

Objective: Provide real-time insights and recommendations.

How it works:

  • SAP Joule offers suggestions, such as which deliveries might be delayed ⏳ or which customers need follow-up 📞.

  • Employees can take immediate, informed actions 🏃‍♂️.

Benefit for growth:
Employees make smarter decisions faster ⚡, improving delivery efficiency 🚚, customer loyalty ❤️, and operational agility 🏬. Real-time guidance reduces mistakes and accelerates response times ⏱️.

Analogy: Smart advisor – gives insights in real-time.

6. Integrating Security & Identity with SAP BTP IAS/IPS 🔒🛡️🔑

Objective: Secure AI and process automation tools while ensuring correct user access.

How it works:

  • IAS manages Single Sign-On (SSO) 🔐 for employees interacting with SAP AI tools.

  • IPS ensures only authorized users are provisioned into the system 👤.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain protects sensitive customer and supplier data 🗂️, ensures compliance 📋, and safely enables access to AI tools across multiple locations 🌐.

Analogy: Security gatekeeper – ensures authorized access to AI tools & data.

7. Monitoring & Continuous Improvement with SAP Cloud ALM 📊🖥️⚡

Objective: Ensure the system works well and keeps improving.

How it works:

  • Track AI model performance and automated workflows using SAP Cloud ALM 📈.

  • Use feedback and metrics to refine AI models and automations 🔄.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can continuously improve operations 🏬, adapt to market changes 🔄, and maintain high customer satisfaction 😃. Monitoring helps spot inefficiencies before they affect operations ⚠️.

Analogy: System monitor – tracks performance & supports continuous improvement.

8. Enabling Real-Time Events with SAP Event Mesh 🌐⚡

Objective: Ensure real-time communication between systems and trigger actions instantly across the O2C process.

How it works:

  • SAP Event Mesh enables event-driven messaging, connecting orders, inventory updates, delivery notifications, and payment confirmations.

  • Works seamlessly with SAP Build Process Automation and AI predictions to trigger automated workflows immediately.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can respond instantly to order changes, prevent stockouts, and ensure customers get accurate delivery updates 🚚📲. Real-time events also help coordinate multiple stores and warehouses efficiently 🏬, improving overall operational agility.

Analogy: Real-time traffic controller – directs information instantly to where it’s needed, keeping the flow smooth.

9. Business Insights with SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) 📊💡

Objective: Turn all collected data and AI predictions into actionable dashboards and reports.

How it works:

  • SAC connects to SAP Datasphere and AI Core models to provide interactive dashboards, forecasts, and KPI tracking.

  • Managers and executives can visualize order trends, inventory levels, and delivery performance in real-time.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can make data-driven strategic decisions, optimize promotions, plan inventory better, and track overall performance 📈. This strengthens customer satisfaction and profitability.

Analogy: Digital dashboard – shows the full picture at a glance for informed decisions.

Architecture Diagram

     ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────┐
     │  🏢💾📊 SAP Datasphere                        │
     │  (Central Nervous System – integrates &      │
     │   harmonizes data from multiple sources)     │
     └───────────────┬──────────────────────────────┘
                     │
                     ▼
     ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────┐
     │  ⚙️🛠️📈 SAP AI Foundation                     │
     │  (AI Control Center – orchestrates & monitors│
     │   AI models and workflows)                   │
     └───────────────┬──────────────────────────────┘
                     │
                     ▼
     ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────┐
     │  🤖📡🔮 SAP AI Core & ML DI                   │
     │  (Predictive Brain – builds & deploys AI     │
     │   models for forecasting & insights)         │
     └───────────────┬──────────────────────────────┘
                     │
                     ▼
     ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────┐
     │  🔄🤖📝 SAP Build Process Automation          │
     │  (Workflow Robot – automates repetitive tasks│
     │   and business processes)                    │
     └───────────────┬──────────────────────────────┘
                     │
                     ▼
     ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────┐
     │  💡📌🧑‍💼 SAP Joule                             │
     │  (Smart Advisor – provides real-time insights│
     │   and recommendations to employees)          │
     └───────────────┬──────────────────────────────┘
                     │
                     ▼
     ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────┐
     │  🔒🛡️🔑 SAP BTP IAS / IPS                     │
     │  (Security Gatekeeper – ensures authorized   │
     │   access to AI tools & data)                 │
     └───────────────┬──────────────────────────────┘
                     │
                     ▼
     ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────┐
     │  📊🖥️⚡ SAP Cloud ALM                          │
     │  (System Monitor – tracks performance &      │
     │   supports continuous improvement)           │
     └───────────────┬──────────────────────────────┘
                     │
                     ▼
     ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────┐
     │  🌐⚡ SAP Event Mesh                          │
     │  (Real-time Event Messaging – triggers       │
     │   workflows instantly)                       │
     └───────────────┬──────────────────────────────┘
                     │
                     ▼
     ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────┐
     │  📊💡 SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC)               │
     │  (Business Insights – dashboards & KPIs)     │
     └──────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Industry Example / Use Case Snapshot 🥬📦

Scenario: A grocery chain receives an online order for fresh produce, including perishable vegetables and fruits.

End-to-End Flow Using SAP Tools:

  1. Data Integration (SAP Datasphere 🏢💾)

    • The order details, inventory levels, and supplier availability are immediately centralized.

  2. Predictive Insights (SAP AI Core & ML DI 🤖)

    • AI predicts potential delivery delays due to traffic or stock shortages and estimates optimal delivery routes.

  3. Automation (SAP Build Process Automation 🔄🤖)

    • The system automatically confirms the order, checks stock, and triggers procurement if needed.

  4. Real-Time Events (SAP Event Mesh 🌐⚡)

    • Updates on stock, delivery status, and payment confirmations are shared instantly across all systems.

  5. Employee Guidance (SAP Joule 💡🧑‍💼)

    • Warehouse staff receive recommendations on packing priorities for perishable items to minimize spoilage.

  6. Analytics & Reporting (SAC 📊💡)

    • Managers monitor order fulfillment KPIs, customer satisfaction, and stock movement in dashboards.

  7. Monitoring & Continuous Improvement (Cloud ALM 📊⚡)

    • Performance metrics from this order feed into ongoing AI model tuning and process optimization.

Outcome:

  • The perishable order is delivered fresh, on time, and with minimal wastage.

  • Employees work efficiently guided by AI insights.

  • Managers gain actionable insights, helping the grocery chain increase customer satisfaction and reduce losses.

Key Takeaways ✅

  • Streamlined Operations 🏢🤖: SAP tools optimize the entire Order-to-Cash workflow.

  • Smart Decisions 💡📊: AI predictions and dashboards support faster, data-driven choices.

  • Automation & Real-Time ⚡🔄: Workflows run instantly with minimal manual effort.

  • Guided Workforce 🧑‍💼💡: Employees get actionable insights in real time.

  • Secure & Monitored 🔒📊: Access is controlled and performance continuously tracked.

  • Customer Satisfaction 🚚❤️: Faster fulfillment, fewer errors, and smarter operations boost growth.

Ask & Learn 🤔

Q1: What is Order-to-Cash (O2C)?
It’s the process of taking a customer order, delivering the product, and receiving payment.

Q2: Do I need technical skills to use these SAP AI tools?
No. Tools like SAP Joule and SAC provide simple insights and dashboards that non-technical employees can use.

Q3: How does SAP Event Mesh help in this workflow?
Event Mesh enables real-time messaging between systems, triggering automated workflows instantly for faster operations.

Q4: Can automation replace employees?
Automation handles repetitive tasks, allowing employees to focus on higher-value work and make smarter decisions with AI guidance.

Q5: How does SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) add value?
SAC converts data and AI predictions into dashboards and KPIs, enabling strategic and operational decisions.

Q6: How is data security ensured?
SAP BTP IAS/IPS manages user authentication and provisioning, ensuring only authorized access to AI tools and sensitive data.

Q7: How do I measure improvement?
SAP Cloud ALM tracks system performance, AI model effectiveness, and workflow efficiency for continuous improvement.

entry.title: Rebates
entry.content:
Hi All,
The issue relates to rebates. Rebate no. 31286 has not current accrual. To make accrual current Accounting Team uses VBOF tcode. Unfortunately, when Agnieszka entered rebate 31286 into VBOF transaction, she received notification:

Due to this notification, we cannot make accrual current. All above invoices have been issued before June 2024 and have this same billing type ZCI. Invoices from #921345566 to #921347271 have old provision account 214216. The rest have new provision account 114128. All invoices are visible in rebate agreement (in Drill-down Menu). I have checked Change report for all listed invoices. SAP does not report any changes for them.

The other ZCI invoices, issued after June 2024, are not blocking the VBOF.

Could you please support us in this case? 

Nothing changed. We still do not see accruals

 

The issue is with Z209 condition type only, but it is affected differently.

For example, the invoice 921103655 as an example to explain the issue with billing date 02.05.2024

Billing document 921103655 was created with pricing procedure ZCRAE.

It has net value 885.06 EUR = Z003 condition value 894.00 EUR +  Z209 condition value 8.94- EUR.

The issue is in Pricing Procedure ZCRAE ( Configuration ) the condition type Z209 somehow removed in the configuration.

May be because the invoices which are showing in the VBOF are created when Z209 exist in the configuration. Because it is removed from configuration, VBOF is showing the 4 invoices which are not updated.

 Below screenshots are from WPR and another system having old data.

 WPR system missing Z209 in configuration.

Another system ( SDR ) having old configuration 

Now the Solution will be complex to solve, whether needs to cancel the invoices and recreate ( 2024 invoices is not possible ) or need to revert the configuration with Z209 condition type and run the VBOF again. 

 Please suggest how should we proceed.

entry.title: Re: implementing Calculation of FLSA Overtime Pay on Add on pay and Bonus
entry.content: Hello.. we are experiencing a similar challenge on a project I am a part of. Currently we have our over-time wage types configured with specification for processing class 3 (Contributes to RR with number and amount, is valuated with RR) but this is including the premium portion of the over-time in the calculation which inflates the regular rate of pay. Our client only has single wage types for over-time they pass to us in IT2010 via integration (not split out by straight time portion and premium). Is there a way to configure some custom rules in SAP without asking the client to create and pass new wage types?

entry.title: Issue with Skipped Purchase Order Number Sequence
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support,

We have encountered an issue where Purchase Order (PO) numbers were skipped even though they were created on the same date.
We would like to request clarification on the cause of this issue, as we need to explain it to our management and auditors.

Thank you & Best Regards


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Issue with Skipped Purchase Order Number Sequence
entry.content:
Hello,

There is no gap control for Purchase Orders, so we do not guarantee sequential numbering or no gap numbering. However, the number generation for Purchase Order permits the usage of buffers to avoid wastage of numbers. Therefore any Purchase Order is deleted, this order ID can be used up in future for any new document. This also avoids that documents have duplicate numbering.
This configuration is applicable for Shopping Cart and Purchase Request document as well. Hope this clarifies your questions.

The system likely reverted due to the deletion of the old document numbered. We cannot confirm this as once the document is deleted in the UI is also deleted from the backend, so we do not have the change log of deleted documents. Essentially, the system was attempting to fill up all the gaps in number sequence.

Hope this clarifies your queries.

Thanks,
Diéssica
SAP Support
Community: https://www.sap.com/community/topics/business-bydesign.html
Customer Influence: https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/campaign/886

entry.title: Re: Eligibility Rule - Adding an Employee
entry.content:
Hi @Jennifer10 

Which eligibility rule is this ? Just checking because in VarPay an employee can only get added to a worksheet if they have a record in Plan Setup > Edit Employee History. 

You can add a parent OR condition to your employee history business rule to add exceptions then reimport employee history.

All the best,

Xavier

entry.title: Re: Variable Pay – Use Proration only with last assignmen...
entry.content:
Hi @Oltion_Rrumbullaku57 

We don't support these 4 situations in standard in one template. 

We have "Point in time" feature which allows us to decide if we want to get the Target or the Earnings as of a set date to be used in Basis Calculation (vs using the salary and earnings of each assignment).

But we can't say : "for this group of employees only use the Target % as of that date but reflect all salary changes" and "for these other employees use the salary as of that date but reflect the target % changes".

 

In order to do that you would you have to build an MDF object with OnSave rules (fed from Integration Center) as the source for your employee history columns.

All the best,

Xavier

entry.title: Crystal Reports runtimes get corrupted
entry.content:
We are using the x86 Crystal Runtime SP36 to render business reporting on our Windows PCs.  Lately we have been getting a lot of PCs where the crystal runtime has been 'corrupted'.  Reports will stop rendering until we remove and reinstall the runtime cleanly.  I guess my question is has anybody ever seen this before and if not, where can I even start to troubleshoot this?

Some of the error messages "Unable to find an entry point named 'PEOpenEngineEX' in DLL 'crpe32.dll'" and "Class not registered - DTSConnection"

It happens randomly and typically we'll get one machine every day.  Any ideas of where to start looking?

entry.title: Re: Web Dispatcher getting Application Quits Error while...
entry.content:
Hi SurangaWe

Please refer to SAP Note 3101585 - How to Solve the Issue - When You Log On to the Browser Access Service, Error Message "Service is currently unavailable" Shows and check if it helps.

Also please make sure of the RAM occupancy on the server. Please make sure any other application or utility is not occupying the bigger memory from your Server. Also check and make sure the password * certificate does not contain special characters, we have found some special character for example '!'”&” will cause certificate verification problem.

If issue still persists, please follow attached SAP Note 2442627 - Troubleshooting Browser Access in SAP Business One, section  How to Get Detailed Log for Browser Access Issues, to collect and collect below details:

1. Gatekeeper log.

2. SAP Business One client logs.

3. General timestamps when you are reproducing reported issue.

create a case using component SBO-BC-PER-BRW and attach above information for further investigation by SAP Business One Support.

Kind Regards
Nidhi 
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Production Process in SAP S4 HANA Public Cloud Edition

However, I don't need to enter an R100, since this would add a piece at the end of the order, and this would no longer be correct.

I'll add a little more detail to the scenario and requirement.

The client needs to know the stock level of the quantity of R100 pieces for sale.
They also need to know the quantity of R01, R102, and R103 pieces for sale.
Therefore, they can assemble R01, R102, and R103 to obtain an R100.

And they can disassemble the R100 to obtain R01, R102, and R103.
I understand the best way to do this is through a Goods Issue AND Goods Receipt?
I'm waiting for your confirmation.
Greetings.

I don't know what exactly could be leading to your scenario.

entry.title: No More Guesswork: Joule’s Help Content Makes SAP Fieldglass Easy to Use
entry.content:
Joule for SAP Fieldglass is a productivity accelerator embedded directly into your SAP Fieldglass experience. Joule uses natural language processing to help users complete tasks, retrieve documentation, and make decisions faster—all without leaving the application.

Whether you're creating job postings or navigating other tasks, Joule delivers smart, contextual guidance. It’s like having a support expert built right in.

Use Case: “I’m going out on vacation—how do I assign a proxy?”

This is a common need in SAP Fieldglass ensuring continuity for tasks while away.  Instead of digging through manuals users can ask Joule:

“I’m going out on vacation—how do I assign a proxy?”

Joule delivers the relevant help documentation from the SAP Help Portal, complete with step-by-step instructions. This access to help content empowers users to self-serve confidently—boosting adoption and user experience.

With Joule, SAP Fieldglass becomes intuitive, responsive, and user-friendly. 

Next steps

1) To see more uses cases see the help documentation here - https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_Fieldglass/76e97fe0cccf4d37a5dadc652a375e33/e3dc12e0215447cfa4507eff66e8224b.html?q=joule+for+fieldglass&locale=en-US&version=LATEST

or catch the replay: https://event.on24.com/eventRegistration/EventLobbyServlet?target=reg20.jsp&eventid=4435612&sessionid=1&key=A3DE53CEDE437303128D05B9BAC0AFFA&groupId=6091913&sourcepage=register

entry.title: Re: ISD Implementation Solution for SAP Business Bydesign
entry.content:
Dear customer,

I hope you are well. 

ISD (Input Service Distribution)

The distribution of input tax credit is possible only to those locations which are registered under the same permanent account number (PAN) as that of the ISD’s office. The common credit used by all the locations can be distributed by the ISD on a pro-rata basis, that is, based on the turnover of each location to the aggregate turnover of all the locations to which the credit is distributed. The distribution of ITC in ISD invoices shall be as follows:

Process of booking and GSTR6 return details creation with below steps
Step 1- Supplier Invoice creation for ISD
Step 2- Manual Tax adjustment entry to distribute the ISD Invoice Input
Step 3- GSTR 6 details pull
===================================
Step-1 - Supplier Invoice creation for ISD

Below ISD Tax codes created in the system, please proceed by booking supplier invoice with these codes for that period.

ISD Domestic Purchase Interstate ( IGST )  
ISD Domestic Purchase Intrastate ( CGST &   SGST )  
ISD Domestic Purchase UT (CGST & UTGST) 

Eg:
Create the supplier invoice along with the suitable ISD ( 175,176,177) Tax codes
So that ISD Input tax credit will be in these tax codes.
===================================

Step 2- Manual Tax adjustment entry to distribute the ISD Invoice Input (Created in the Step-1)

Please proceed for creation of “Manual Tax entry under the VAT”
Path- Tax Management work center- Under that Go to - Manual Tax Entries – VAT Entries

With this manual Tax entry, we are distributing the ISD Input to the respective parties.
While creating this Manual Tax entry we need to select the respective “Tax reporting unit”

(While creating this entry, credit the value which we want to distribute by selecting the . respective ISD tax code and Tax reporting unit .Debit the value which we want to distribute to the respective branch/Unit by selecting the respective ISD tax code and Tax reporting unit.
===================================

Step-3 Please proceed for pulling the GSTR-6 return summary

GSTR 6 is a monthly return that has to be filed by an Input Service Distributor. It contains details of ITC received by an Input Service Distributor and distribution of ITC.

This return contains the details of Input tax received for distribution

Kindly check the GSTR-6 is extended under the Tax return Arrangements before pulling the return
( If not kindly extend to your Company & Tax authority)

Eg; For Assigning GST-6 to the respective Company under tax arrangement.

Then proceed for creating GSTR-6 Return for the particular period which we want and run.
Check all the details will be displayed here for that particular period.
(Eg All the Supplier invoices booked under the ISD and distributed under Manual tax entreis).

These details will be helpful to update on the respective return portal for filing return.

Eg:

Create return by selecting respective return details.

Once return run is processed the report will be generated like below.

===================================

In the report
- We can be able to see all the Invoices processed with ISD
- We can be able to see all the Manual tax entries created for distribution.
- We can be able to see report with the below mentioned columns
GST IN number of supplier & receivers
Invoice & Manual tax entry
Tax reporting unit
Report Generation ss

I hope this information help you further.

Regards,
Tiago

entry.title: Re: Business Partner Relationship WebService Inbound
entry.content:
Hello @Simon 

Thank you for your feedback and follow up,

You are correct.The reason InternalID works and ExternalID fails is that the system can only create a relationship if it can resolve both partners to an internal BP number/UUID. When you send ExternalID, it looks up the key mapping for that business system. If it doesn’t find one, you receive the Unknown Business Partner error and the missing ID/UUID' error.

So if you want to keep using ExternalID:

  • Ensure your <SenderBusinessSystemID> in the header SF aligns with the Business System configured to Manage Key Mapping.
  • In Manage Key Mapping, set up entries for both partners, including the internal BP number (padded to 10 digits) and UUID on one side, and your ExternalID on the other.
  • Then the relationship call will resolve successfully with ExternalID.

If you prefer not to maintain mappings, use InternalID directly (or fetch the BP first and then reference its InternalID in the relationship call). The instances where an alphanumeric < 10 worked for you are simply coincidental; this is not dependable behaviour.

Let me know how it goes

With regards

Chuma
Chuma

entry.title: RSBBS: Structure with cost element groups and calculations
entry.content:
Hello. I have two queries, one with aggregated values while in the row section I have a structure like:

- Cost element group A

- Cost element group B

- Sum of both lines

- etc.

I have set up up the report report interface via RSBBS. When I now jump from the first or second line (cost element group A or cost element group B) the jump is working / the 2nd query shows the expected values. 

If I jump from the sum line into the second query the values are not matching / are to high. So it seems the jump conditions are not able to determine the cost elements / cost element groups which are part of the calculation and to pass them to the second query.

Does anyone has an idea who to solve this / what to do in order to pass the details of the calculation rows in the structure?

 

Thanks in advance,

Hansi

entry.title: Re: Error creating BAdI Enhancement Implementation: "SAP...
entry.content:
Hello @diana_gonzalezcr60 

Thank you for sharing the screenshots and details.

The error

SAP object ENHS/ENHO … cannot be assigned to package Z_WHT_EXTENSION_DGR

This occurs because your package is created under the software component ZLOCAL. Objects in ZLOCAL are local and non-transportable, and therefore not valid for enhancement implementations (ENHS/ENHO), which must be stored in a transportable package.

Possible Resolution steps:

  1. Create or utilise a portable software component (not ZLOCAL) supplied for ABAP Cloud development.
  2. Under that SWC, assemble a package including
    •  ABAP language version is the same as ABAP for Cloud Development
    • Recording object changes in transport requests enabled
    • Assigned transport layer
  3. Create your BAdI implementation in this new package and assign it to the relevant transport request.
  4. Transport the objects using Software Collections / ATO not classic CTS .

This is the expected system behaviour; enhancement implementations cannot be stored in ZLOCAL.

SAP Useful References:

  • SAP Help Portal – ABAP Development Tools: Packages and Software Components
  • SAP Help Portal – Working with Software Components in ABAP Cloud
  • SAP API Business Hub – Extensibility (BAdI)

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Automating Plan Data Creation - IFP to Rapid xP&A
entry.content:
Hi there,

There is a strong business case to use IFP for granular planning at an operations perspective for a manufacturing organization but also for the same organization to use Rapid xP&A at the CFO level. My goal is to provide our users with the best of both worlds. Leverage the essential planning actions such as allocations, activity rate planning and product costing but also allow the CFO to have compelling standard dashboards and reporting to make high-level business decisions. 

My question is, has anyone in the SAC community been able to copy the plan data derived from IFP, and push them into the supporting data models included in rapid xP&A. I feel if this data action is not plausible, the viability of both packages being delivered to the same organization would be difficult as it may result in inconsistent reporting, so hoping someone has dealt with this before.

entry.title: ICMR Adjustment Workflow (WS78500087) – No Fiori Notification on Workflow Start
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I have a question regarding ICMR Adjustment Workflows in S/4HANA.

We are using the standard workflow WS78500087 for adjustment postings, and technically it works fine – the workflow is created, and users can approve or reject it in My Inbox.

However, we noticed unusual behavior regarding Fiori notifications:

  • When the workflow is created and a work item is sent to the approver, no notification appears in the Fiori Launchpad.

  • Only after the workflow is approved or rejected, a notification is generated that the workflow has been completed (approved/rejected).

So my questions are:

  1. Is this the expected standard behavior for WS78500087 / ICMR workflows?

  2. If yes, is there a simple way to enable Fiori notifications for workitem creation? (i.e., when the approval task is sent to the user’s inbox)?

Thanks in advance for your support!

entry.title: ABAP Prog to create 2 sheets/tabs in ONE MS excel workbook & email
entry.content:
Hi,
Can anyone help me with a prog to create ONE MS excel workbook with 2 sheets/tabs and get emailed in background.
note: PLS DONT suggest me any GITHUB related as i see HTTP 411 / SSL errors..etc

I have copied the prog BCS_EXAMPLE_7 to a Z*prog & tried adding the code as below:

* add the spread sheet as attachment to document object
document->add_attachment(
i_attachment_type = 'xls'  
i_attachment_subject = 'Example2 ' " 
i_attachment_size = size
i_att_content_hex = binary_content ).

But its still sending 2 different excel sheets in One MS excel attachment.

Pls suggest.

entry.title: Tasks shown in the Calendar Highlights on the home screen are not getting the provided context
entry.content:
We are creating tasks from the calendar that reference stories with specific context filters.

When we access the task directly from the calendar, the linked story is correctly filtered.

However, when we access the task from the Calendar Highlights section on the home screen, the context is not applied, and the story is displayed without any filters.

Last year around this same time, it was working. I don't know if anyone else had the same problem and if they were able to solve it.

Thanks in advance,

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud integration for data services -SAP IBP to SAP IBP
entry.content: Hello, I noticed across different projects that for IBP to IBP dataflows that contain multiple joins between IBP tables, whenever any calculation is applied to a given field, the time performance of that dataflow is greatly diminished. If I delete those calculations altogether the DF works as expected timewise. Has this been raised up before? Is there a KB or solution to it that doesn't involve changing the type of DF (IBP to IBP)?

entry.title: Re: How can I fetch user Default Values using an ABAP Res...
entry.content:
Hi @moreelremy 

SAP Fiori Launchpad Default values are stored in USR05 table and you can use CDS view I_UserParameter_F2200  to get specific parameter value per user. The parameter of the Plant is WRK.

Example in CDS View's parameter:

    @Consumption.derivation: { lookupEntity: ‘I_UserParameter_F2200’,
    resultElement: ‘UserParameterValue’, binding: [
    { targetElement : ‘UserParameter’ , type : #CONSTANT, value : ‘WRK’ } ]
    }
    P_Plant: werks_d ,

References:

  • SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA – Synchronizing Default Values with Set/Get Parameters
  • Date Function for dynamic date filtering in Fiori apps

Thanks,
Tuncay

entry.title: कुकू एफएम पर शिकायत कैसे करें?
entry.content: पर कॉल कर सकते हैं.. कुकू एफएम (Kuku FM) से शिकायत दर्ज करने के लिए, आप इन-ऐप चैट सहायता सेO←+91-9233-908-323 संपर्क कर सकते हैं, ईमेल कर सकते हैं, या उनके ग्राहक सेवा हेल्पलाइन नंबर (O+91-9233-908-323.} पर कॉल कर सकते हैं.

entry.title: एयरटेल पेमेंट बैंक से पैसे कट जाए तो क्या करें?
entry.content: एयरटेल पेमेंट बैंक से पैसे कट जाए तो क्या करें? ग्राहक सहायता टीम (0923↑39↑08↑323} तक पहुंच सकते हैं और जितनी जल्दी हो सके अपनी शिकायत दर्ज कर सकते हैं। हेल्पलाइन नंबर +91_92339↑08323 धन वापसी हेतु 24x7 सहायता उपलब्ध, अभी कॉल करें

entry.title: Re: एयरटेल पेमेंट बैंक से पैसे कट जाए तो क्या करें?
entry.content: एयरटेल पेमेंट बैंक से पैसे कट जाए तो क्या करें? ग्राहक Murder टीम (ibjbbc} तक पहुंच सकते हैं और जितनी जल्दी हो सके अपनी शिकायत दर्ज कर सकते हैं। हेल्पलाइन नंबर + धन वापसी हेतु 24x7 सहायता उपलब्ध, अभी कॉल करें

entry.title: फोनपे से पैसे काटने के बाद शिकायत कैसे दर्ज करें?
entry.content: मैं Phone pe पर गलत लेनदेन से अपना पैसा कैसे वापस पा सकता हूँ? Phone Pe में गलती से किसी गलत खाते में पैसे ट्रांसफर हो जाने पर, तुरंत Phone Pe ग्राहक सहायता 00,91-2288-√7463 संपर्क करें और अपने बैंक को भी सूचित करें.
